M E N T Taking a Point Solution Approach to EBusiness Good luck Unless youre feeling very very lucky pick up your EBusiness Success Kit today clkpgoSrcAct A D V E R T I S E M E N T Catch of the Day Listen and understand Streaming video may be a bust from a business perspective but that doesnt stop companies from trying to innovate For example this week I met with Tim Sibley the founder of StreamSage His product listens to the words in audio or video files then compiles custom sets of clips in response to search queries The product glues together speechrecognition technology from SRI Cycorps syntactic and semantic processors and StreamSages own code In a demo the system delivered good responses to search queries against a video of a Qwest shareholders meeting The system matches concepts not just words and it picks good times to start and end a clip unlike some systems that just target a word and pad a fixed buffer of content on either side of it Tim has visions of a world in which consumers perhaps on some future TiVo can compile completely custom programs Fortunately reason prevails and his current plan is to sell StreamSage to enterprises like those with large libraries of training videos StreamSages technical advantages notwithstanding it is underfunded and up against established competitors including Virage Convera and MediaSite In other words its employees are acquisition bait But whos buying Rafe Needleman Editor COMPANIES StreamSage SRI International Cycorp Virage Convera MediaSite RELATED STORIES Catch of the Day New medias weakest link
